abstracts.cdata!:
The Health Financing and Management
            Project seeks to: 1) improve the efficiency and the quality
            of care in project hospitals; 2) mobilize additional
            resources; and 3) strengthen Ministry of Health's
            (MOH's) policy formulation and sector management
            capacity. There are three project components. The first
            component, strengthening hospital management and improving
            service quality, will strengthen hospital strategic planning
            capacity and introducing organizational and management
            tools, procedures, and information systems needed for
            decision-making and resource allocation processes. It will
            also establish quality control mechanisms, implement
            staffing norms, and provide training. The second component,
            improving health sector financing, will develop and
            introduce a health insurance scheme with mandatory
            enrollment for public and formal private sector employees,
            and develop and test financing mechanisms which ensure
            access to health care for the poor. The third component,
            strengthening policy and decision-making capacities, will
            assist MOH to adjust and perform its functions in the
            context of the Regionalization Law, provide MOH
            administration with the management and data tools required
            for policy formulation, and help MOH to implement its sector strategy.
